page.title: 14TRANSPORT, NORTH CREAKE
page.content: There is a dependence on private cars for personal transport. The nearest railway station is at Kings Lynn, twenty four miles away. School buses take infants to Burnham Market, seniors to Wells, and students to the Technical College at Kings Lynn. Public transport has a Thursday bus to Fakenham, for market day. Those without cars who need to shop in the County towns, rely on neighbours. However, a community bus service manned by volunteer drivers, has started to operate. If it is to become established a large number of amateur drives will have to be found, to be trained to pass driving tests for Public Service Vehicle licenses. There is a taxi service, operating from Fakenham. The elderly without cars are unable to afford the cost of hiring such vehicle
